result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark I. Ratliff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark I. Ratliff is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark I. Ratliff was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark I. Ratliff

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
3:53 pm. Defendant Mark I. Ratliff in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm66 and 14cm316.  In 15cm66 - Court finds defendant guilty.  Michlig/Richards/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing. States moves to dismiss 14cm316 - Granted. In 15cm66 - Court imposes court costs only. 
Appeal rights given
  Review hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Adj. 4:03 p.m.

03:05 pm - Defendant Mark I. Ratliff in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to dismiss Count 2 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Michlig/Richards/Court statement to sentencing.  As part of the agreement - State will not move to rescind DPA in case 14cm316 at this time.  Court adjourns sentencing until review hearing of the DPA.  Bail continued.  
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

Defendant Mark I. Ratliff in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:42
In receipt, waive reading - not guilty plea
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
no intoxicants in any amount in any location, no taverns, may not be on McDonald's premises

02:07 pm - Defendant Mark I. Ratliff in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  MIchlig statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
